Emily Larson, Duluth Mayor
May 6 at 9:41 PM ·

The City of Duluth will be lighting the Aerial Lift Bridge in honor of all Duluth high school and college graduating seniors. We made the announcement during today’s City of Duluth weekly press conference. Each Duluth college
and high school will be celebrated individually. The Lift Bridge will be lit at dusk, and will be lit overnight.

In honor of all of our graduates, the Aerial Lift Bridge lighting will reflect the pride this community feels for our graduates. We hope that this signals how proud we are of them, and that we believe in their bright future.

The schedule for the Lift Bridge lighting can be found below:

May 9 - UMD maroon & gold
May 10 - CSS blue & gold
May 18 - LSC teal blue
June 2 - Area Learning Center & Academic Excellence Online High School royal blue
June 3 - Duluth East red
June 4 - Duluth Denfeld maroon & gold
June 5 - Lakeview Christian Academy blue
June 6 - Harbor City blue &white
June 7 - Marshall gold

Happy graduation season, and check out the video below!

📽👇

Harbor City Presents "The Girl in the White Pinafore"

Show opens on Thursday Dec. 5th at 7pm!
Adults $10.00 Students $5.00
On the last day of his life, William Chesley Shaw is haunted by his past. Special Education Teacher, 1.0 FTE
Harbor City International School in Duluth, Minnesota is seeking a special education teacher to join our team.

Qualifications: The ideal candidate will be Minnesota certified in one or more of the following licensure areas - LD, EBD, and/ or ASD.

Salary is commensurate with education and experience. We are accepting applications until the position is filled.

Google Game Design- Enter before May 16! Did you know that 65% of women play mobile games, making up half of all mobile gamers? Even though women are playing mobile games like never before, only 23% of the game developers identify as women.

To combat this, Google Play launched the Change The Game Design Challenge. To enter, students submit an idea for a game for the chance to win the grand prize of a $10,000 college scholarship and $15,000 for their school's technology program. 5 finalists will be selected to present their idea at E3 in Los Angeles.
No computer science skills are necessary, only an imagination and writing skills to share their vision for a game. If able, students are encouraged to share sketches or visuals of their game characters, settings, and more. It is suggested that students spend at least an hour on their design.
All entries must be submitted by Wednesday, May 16th.

Contact Mr. Dexter (mdexter@harborcityschool.org) with questions!

Letters to Sala opens Thursday night at 7 pm and runs through Sunday:

Adapted from the book "Sala’s Gift" by Ann Kirschner and based on a true account, Letters to Sala is a remarkable story of a young girl's survival during wartime Germany. Sala Garncarz Kirschner hid over 300 letters while she was a prisoner housed in seven different Nazi labor camps over the course of five years. Keeping her secret for over fifty years, Sala concealed her incredibly painful history in a Spill and Spell box until the time came to share the letters with her family. Taking place in both the 1940s and present day New York City, Letters to Sala follows young Sala’s journey through the camps as the descendants of older Sala come to terms with the past and struggle to decide the fate of the letters.

Three-hundred students from Minnesota have been named National Merit Semifinalists for 2018. The seniors, who scored among the top 1 percent of students nationally on the PSAT, will compete for some 7,500 scholarships worth more than $32 million.

-AJ Mullozzi

Beach Clean-Up Results- Keep It Clean!

A HUGE THANK YOU to the 29 volunteers (students and staff) who participated in the Alliance for the Great Lakes beach cleanup!
We collected over 1,000 pieces of trash in the 30 minutes we spent sweeping the beach! Included in those pieces of trash were 344 cigarette butts, over 84 pieces of foam, and over 315 pieces of plastic. These pieces of garbage are no longer on the beach, in Lake Superior, or potentially harming living organisms-because of the volunteers!!!
We hope to have another beach cleanup in the spring, so stay tuned for details and join us for the next beach sweep!
